data.TITLE: ISC BIND Denial of Service (DoS) Vulnerability (CVE-2025-13878)
data.DIAGNOSIS:
ISC BIND (Berkley Internet Domain Name) is an implementation of DNS protocols.

Affected versions:
BIND 9.18.40 to 9.18.43
BIND 9.20.13 to 9.20.17
BIND 9.21.12 to 9.21.16
BIND 9.18.40-S1 to 9.18.43-S1
BIND 9.20.13-S1 to 9.20.17-S1

Patched Versions:
BIND 9.18.44
BIND 9.20.18
BIND 9.21.17
BIND 9.18.44-S1
BIND 9.20.18-S1

QID Detection Logic:
This unauthenticated check detects vulnerable systems by fetching the version information from the BIND service using the banner.
data.CONSEQUENCE: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability may cause the named to crash by sending a request that results in a corrupt or malicious record.
data.SOLUTION:
Customers are advised to upgrade to the patched version latest release of CVE-CVE-2025-13878
